ngoList.title: Peniel Society
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Peniel Society was founded with the object of addressing rapid increase in the number of IDU in the area. Since the very inception it has been rendering humanitarian service including spiritual and physiological support by providing care, treatment and rehabilitative service. It is a registered body under Societies Registration Act of 1860 and the Headquarter is located at Keifang, Champhai Road covering the target groups of Keifang, Saitual, Kawlkulh Rulchawm and the surrounding areas

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Free Vocational training has been delivered to more than 2000 youth across the state and placement was provided to 40% of beneficiaries. And 20% of beneficiaries are seting up their own enterprises with the help of the Organisation. Along with vocational training anti trafficking campaign and safe migration and safe working environment programme is promoted. The Main objective is to promote entreprenuership among the youth to have sustainable economic life and alround development

isuues.name: Key Issues
isuues.value: Art & Culture,Children,Civic Issues,Education & Literacy,HIV/AIDS,Sports,Tribal Affairs,Vocational Training,Any Other,Aged/Elderly

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Thutak Nunpuitu Team (TNT) has been undertaking rehabilitaion for the depressed class of society by maintaining a De-addiction Centre at Aizawl, Lunglei, Kolasib and Champhai; Orphange at Aizawl, Mental Home at Aizawl, Lunglei and Kolasib. Since TNT has firmly established its trustworthiness and good reputation in humanitarian activities for aconsiderable lenght of time, all sort of unwanted children like those of parents separated due to drug or alcohol abused, many street children are brought together by social activist and law enforcement and other NGO. These pitiable young souls need to teach everything, they need to know social manner and how to read and write. So, TNT established a residential school for them. The school give opportunities not only for orphans but also for recovering addicts and some of them are now even school teachers. TNT strongly belives that co-carricular activities is a must for children, its implementing indoor and outdoor sport facilities; vocatioanal training namely computer class, music, art and culture, handicraft and tailoring, plumbing and electronics.There are some illiterate people especialy who came from neighboring states, Adult Eduction was opened for them. Followings are the major achivement of the Society: 1. De-addiction Centre is the place where notorious people, dug addict and alcoholic were giving treatment. They are provided good care for healing their mental and body. They are guided and governed under good and strict rules and regulation. Till date over 27000 patients had been treated and morethan 5780 were recovered from their addiction. 2. The famous Pangpar Huan (Garden of Flowers) is a name of Mental Hom. Patient were given love and sincere care without alopathic medicines. A number of 8200 patient from all over north east states and Mayanmar were admitted and 2733 people received blessing to lead a total normal life. 3. Orphanage is one of the largest in the world, they are 414 orphanse today at the Home. Apart from academic education numerous co-carricular activities are implemented. Which resulted to recieved 36 National medals, 520 state medal and many trophies. Cultural troops and Pipe Band study class also make a good impresion among children. Till today there are 1039 orphans have been looked after and many of them have a prosperous and content life.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Paradise songsters under Universal Hindi Communications Centre has been the first to record Hindi patriotic songs in Door Darshan Kendra, Guwahati as far back as 12.3.2002. As far back as the first academic session of 2000, Universal Hindi Communications Centre has imparted free education of teaching Hindi to Non-Hindi speakers using the special language SHSC course of Advance level to BA level. This mission is the first of its kind in Mizoram and Universal is the pioneer in this regard.

ngoList.title: Women Anti Drug Association

isuues.name: Key Issues
isuues.value: Health & Family Welfare,HIV/AIDS,Human Rights,Micro Finance (SHGs),Prisoner's Issues,Vocational Training,Women's Development & Empowerment,Youth Affairs

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Women Anti-Drug Association in short WADA was established in 1996 and is one of the registered non-governmental organizations in Mizoram. It grew into a big organization and the State Government gave recogniÂ¬tion to their activities and functions. It gave funding through Mizoram State AIDS Control Society (MSACS) to fight HIV and Drugs among Injecting Drug Users (IDUâ€™s) of Lunglei and Hnahthial town and among Jail Inmates of Lunglei District Jail. The Organization also has a Treatment-Cum-Rehabilitation Centre funded by Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment (MSJ&E), Govâ€™t of India. The Centre at present can accommoÂ¬date 15 clients. The Centre gives a comprehensive program with a three-stage treatment consistÂ¬ing of Detoxification, De-Addiction and Rehabilitation. It also tries to give patients a holistic care not only in terms of physical but emotional, mental and spiritual healing as well. It also provides them with vocational skills and when possible, a work place so as to make their rehabilitation within society easier WADA under the sponsorship of UNODC also have I-81 Project that aims at the care and support of the People Living With HIV/AIDS and G-86 Project to empower community on drugs and HIV/AIDS. Under the G-86 Project) SHGâ€™s were formed and the members are from the target groups, the Ex-IDUâ€™s and Ex-DUâ€™s. All these SHG members are given training on the basic formation of SHG, micro Credits and linkage of SHG with the Banks two times in the year 2006 - 2007. Under this project, commercial sex workers are also contacted and given awareness about high risk behavior and various means and prevention to STD and HIV/AIDS, their rights and duties to their clients. In Feb 2006, A Peer Led Intervention Project (PLI) to help in reducing the risk of HIV/AIDS among drug users under Society for Promotion of Youth and Masses (SPYM)/DFID was also entrusted to the NGO. The organization also impleÂ¬ments Maternal and Family Planning Intervention from April 2006, which deals with promotion of family planning, health and nutritional requirement amongst expectant mothers and child

ngoList.address: Damna In (Healing Home), Zuangtui, - 796017
ngoList.title: Zoram Drivers Ramthim Board
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Zoram Drivers Union (ZDU) was set up in the year 1957. Initially, the Association had been working for the welfare of the people within the state by arranging transportation throughout the state till Transport Department was set up by the Govt. of Mizoram. It also worked for the benefit of its Driver members and gave counselling to alcaholic drivers. After sometime, it was learned that the services provided to drivers was insufficient and this give rise to a new concept of a special field of function, this brought forth the formation of Zoram Driversâ€™ Ramthim Board on the 20th June, 1969 with the Zoram Driversâ€™ Union as its nodal organization. After the outbreak of Drugs Abuse, it also concentrates on Drugs abuse prevention and care, consequently De-Addiction cum Rehabilitation Centre of Damna In (meaning â€˜Healing Homeâ€™) was set up in 1986. Further, after the prevalence of HIV / AIDS, the Board showed their concern and willingness to take part in preventing and caring of the affected ones. It extended its services for women who are without any social and economic support who are without family and also victims of domestic violence and marital disputes
